Class InputGameAdapter

java.lang.Object
lista4.adapters.InputGameAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameInputAdapter<String>
public class InputGameAdapter extends Object implements GameInputAdapter<String>
An implementation of GameInputAdapter tailored for Console/Terminal clients.

This class handles text-based input from the standard console. It interprets typed commands and converts them into game moves.

Key features:

  • Parses standard algebraic notation (e.g., "D 16") into board indices.
  • Provides human-readable error messages suitable for console display.
  • Updates the GameManager with the appropriate console output adapter.

  • Method Details

    • setOutAdapter

      public void setOutAdapter(GameOutputAdapter outAdapter)
      Switches the Game Manager's output channel to the Console adapter.

      This is critical when switching control between different interface types to ensure the game prints text responses instead of GUI commands.

      Specified by:
      setOutAdapter in interface GameInputAdapter<String>
      Parameters:
      outAdapter - The GameOutputAdapter to set.

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(String input, PlayerColor color) throws WrongMoveFormat
      Interprets a text command as a game move.

      Accepted format: [A-S] [1-19] (case insensitive).
      Example: "a 1" translates to (0,0). "s 19" translates to (18,18).

      Specified by:
      makeMove in interface GameInputAdapter<String>
      Parameters:
      input - The text string typed by the user.
      color - The color of the player making the move.
      Throws:
      WrongMoveFormat - If the command syntax is incorrect (e.g., out of bounds or wrong format).

    • sendBoard

      public void sendBoard(PlayerColor color)
      Triggers the sending of the ASCII representation of the board.
      Specified by:
      sendBoard in interface GameInputAdapter<String>
      Parameters:
      color - The player for whom the board is being refreshed.
